'''Lampent''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ランプラー''' ''Lampler'') is a dual-type {{2t|Ghost|Fire}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Litwick}} starting at level 41 and evolves into {{p|Chandelure}} when exposed to a [[Dusk Stone]].

==Biology==
Lampent has a clear, spherical head containing a bluish purple flame and oval, yellow eyes. On top of its head is a black covering, which resembles a {{wp|lampshade}}, with a pointed spike on top. Underneath its head is a small, black body with a pointed spike at the bottom. Extending from its body are two long, wavy arms with no fingers. It floats through the air to move.

Lampent can sense when someone is about to die, whom it visits and steals the spirit from the person's body. Though most often found in deep forests, it wanders through cities and hangs around near hospitals to absorb the spirits of the fallen. It uses the spirits it has absorbed to fuel its fire. On occasion, it has been known to work with {{p|Litwick}} to lead people to the Ghost World while stealing life energy.

==In the anime==
===Major appearances===
[[File:Trip Lampent.png|thumb|220px|left|Lampent in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
Lampent debuted in ''[[BW022|A Venipede Stampede!]]'', under the ownership of [[Trip]]. He used it to try to help stop a swarm of {{p|Venipede}} from taking over [[Castelia City]].

A Lampent appeared in ''[[BW026|Scare at the Litwick Mansion!]]'' as the leader of a group of {{p|Litwick}}. They tried to take {{Ash}}, {{ashfr}}, and {{TRT}} to the [[Ghost World]].

===Minor appearances===
Multiple Lampent appeared in ''[[BW056|The Lonely Deino!]]'', under the care of [[Bobby]].

A Lampent made a cameo appearance in ''[[BW069|Climbing the Tower of Success!]]''.

A Lampent appeared in a fantasy in ''[[BW120|Ash and N: A Clash of Ideals!]]''.

Five Trainers' Lampent appeared in ''[[SM034|A Crowning Moment of Truth!]]'', with one appearing in a flashback.

==In the manga==
[[File:Rood Lampent Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Lampent in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Trainer's Lampent appeared in ''[[PS486|Unraveling Mysteries]]'' and ''[[PS511|Dream a Little Dream]]''.

[[Rood]] used a Lampent during his battle at the {{un|Pokémon League}} against the Trainers who were helping {{adv|Black}} rescue the captured Gym Leaders in ''[[PS521|Triple Threat]]''.

Prior to ''[[PS526|Mr. Perfect]]'', {{adv|Bianca}}'s Litwick evolved into a Lampent.

==Trivia==
* Lampent represents {{wp|October}} in the [[Unova]] [[horoscope]].

===Origin===
Lampent is a combination of {{wp|Hitodama}} (a blue, black, or purple-fire associated with ghosts and {{wp|yōkai}}, equivalent to the western {{wp|will-o'-the-wisp}}) and an {{wp|Street light|oil street lamp}}.

====Name origin====
Lampent may be a combination of ''lamp'' and ''lambent'' (softly glowing, with connotations of otherworldliness) or ''{{wp|Repentance|repent}}'' (to feel sorrow or regret). It may also refer to ''lament'' (to feel sorrow or grief), a corruption of ''rampant'' (to be violent), ''bent'' (referring to Lampent's bent arms), or ''entity'' (based on Lampent's supernatural origins). It may also involve ''pent'' (to be trapped).

Lampler is derived from ''lamp''.
